Target: OntoCrystal is an ontology developed for representing crystal structure information

Comment: External class for chemical species.
Label: Species

Comment: An object to store a numerical value together with units of measurement. A class from OM-2 ontology.
Label: Measure

Comment: Unit of measurement for a Measure class. Intities of this class are defined in OM-2.
Label: Unit

Comment: An object to store the numerucal value with units and uncertainty.
Label: Measure With Uncertainty

Comment: Represents an N-dimensional array-like structure with units of measurement.
Label: Measure Vector

Comment: Individual components (i.e., x, y, z) of a vector.
Label: Vector Component

Comment: Represents an NxM matrix with unit of measurement. In the context of crystallography matrices can be used for transformations and symmetry operations.
Label: Measure Matrix

Comment: Individual component of the Matrix.
Label: Matrix Component

Comment: A subclass of Vector class, with information about the uncertainty values. Consists of the main Vector with the values and its Uncertainty Vector.
Label: Vector With Uncertainty

Comment: A class to store a 2D array data with uncertainties.
Label: Matrix With Uncertainty

Comment: A 2D scatter plot to represent data.
Label: PlotXY

Comment: A set of data points to be used as Abscissa of a plot. Units of measurement correspond to the quantity on the axis.
Label: Abscissa Data

Comment: A set of data points to be used as Abscissa of a plot. Units of measurement correspond to the quantity on the axis.
Label: Ordinate Data

Comment: AtomPosition is a subclass of VectorWithUncertainty that store the position of atom. The labels are usually "x", "y", "z". The units depend on the type of position (fractional or cartesian).
Label: Position Vector

Comment: CrystalInformation is a subset of CIF file, contains data and properties of a crystaline matter.
Label: Crystal Information

Comment: A class to store atomic positions of all atoms in the crystal.
Label: Atomic Structure

Comment: Information of an in individual atom within a crystallographic unit cell. It stores the 3D coordinates, atom type, and possibly other properties of the atom.
Label: Atom Site

Comment: Atom-site coordinates as fractions of the CellLengths values. Corresponds to _atom_site_fract_ in CIF file.
Label: Atom Fractional Position

Comment: The atom-site coordinates specified according to a set of orthogonal Cartesian axes related to the cell axes. Corresponds to _atom_site_fract_ in CIF file.
Label: Atom Cartesian Position

Comment: A class to store all spatial coordinate transformations between fractional and cartesian coordinate systems.
Label: Coordinate Transformation

Comment: Coordinate transformation matrix from relative to absolute coordinates and vice versa.
Label: Transformation Matrix

Comment: Coordinate transformation vector from relative to absolute coordinates and vice versa.
Label: Transformation Vector

Comment: A class to store all information related to the crystal unit cell.
Label: Unit Cell

Comment: A set of vectors that define the unit cell in the real space (Cartesian coordinates).
Label: Unit Cell Vector Set

Comment: Represents the volume of the unit cell of a crystal. Contains value and units of measurement.
Label: Unit Cell Volume

Comment: In crystallography a part of unit cell parameters. Three values "a", "b", "c" for the lengths of the edges of the unit cell.
Label: Unit Cell Lengths

Comment: In crystallography a part of unit cell parameters. Three values "alpha", "beta", "gamma" for the angles between the unit cell edges.
Label: Unit Cell Angles

Comment: A special case of vector: 3 component with uncertainty and with label: "a", "b", or "c".
Label: Unit Cell Lattice Vector

Comment: Class contains all information about tile information of the crystal.
Label: Tiled Structure

Comment: Class to store information about individual tile
Label: Tile

Comment: Number of tiles of given tipe in a unit cell
Label: Tile Number

Comment: Class to describe tile face.
Label: Tile Face

Comment: Number of faces in a tile
Label: Tile Face Number

Comment: A combination of four values: p - number of kinds of vertices, q - number of kinds of edges, r - number of kinds of edges, s - number of kinds of faces. For more detailes doi:10.1007/s004540010035
Label: Transitivity

Comment: Position of the vertex in the unit cell together with its id.
Label: Tile Vertex

Comment: Information about XRD spectrum of the crystal.
Label: XRD Spectrum

Comment: A continuous spectrum can be approximated by a set of characteristic peaks, that approximate the spectrum.
Label: Characteristic Peak

Comment: A set of 3 numbers (h,k,l). In crystallography it represents a direction with respect to the unit cell axes directions.
Label: Miller Indices

Comment: Citation (article/book/proceeding/etc)
Label: Citation

Comment: The article author. Derived from foaf:Person class.
Label: Author

Comment: The position of the author in the list of authors.
Label: Author Index

Comment: Associates the Vector with its VectorComponents.
Label: has Vector Component

Comment: Associates a Matrix with its MatrixComponents. Matrix has multiple components.
Label: has Matrix Component

Domain: MeasureMatrix UNION MatrixComponent UNION MeasureVector UNION VectorComponent UNION MeasureWithUncertainty
Comment: Indicates that a Vector or Matrix or their components have specific unit of measure, defined in Ontology of Units of Measure (OM-2). Each Component may have individual Unit value. If both Vector and its Component have Units, the latter has priority. Same rules apply to Matrix Components.
Label: has Unit

Comment: The X axis of the xRD spectrum. In crystallography the axis is 2*theta, and measured in degrees.
Label: has Abscissa Data

Comment: The Y axis of the XRD spectrum. In crystallography the axis is in arbitrary units. Here in percent of the highest peak (range 0 to 100).
Label: has Ordinate Data

Comment: Correspondance between data sets to construct plot. The sets must have the same length.
Label: is Abscissa Of

Comment: Relation property to specify the Crystallization Information of a material. It should be used by an external ontology.
Label: has Crystal Information

Comment: Connects CrystalInformation class with its AtomicStructure, which is information about all containing atoms.
Label: has Atomic Structure

Comment: Connects AtomicStructure with individual AtomSites.
Label: has Atom Site

Comment: Relates an AtomSite to a Vector representing its position in Cartesian coordinates.
Label: has Fractional Position

Comment: Similarly, relates an AtomSite with a Vector, but in this case, the position is given in fractional coordinates.
Label: has Cartesian Position

Comment: The specific atom site in the crystal lattice is occupied by a particular type of atom or chemical species.
Label: has Element

Comment: Links a CIF to the collection of CoordinateTransformation.
Label: has Coordinate Transformation

Comment: Connects a CoordinateTransformation to a Matrix that describes how to transform from the crystal's fractional coordinate to Cartesian.
Label: has Transformation Matrix To Cartesian

Comment: Connects a CoordinateTransformation to a Matrix representing the transformation from Cartesian coordinates back to the crystal's fractional coordinates.
Label: has Transformation Matrix To Fractional

Comment: Connects a CoordinateTransformation with a Vector detailing the transformation to Cartesian coordinates, the translation.
Label: has Transformation Vector To Cartesian

Comment: Connects a CoordinateTransformation to a Vector that indicates the coordinate shift for transformation to fractional coordinates of the crystal.
Label: has Transformation Vector To Fractional

Comment: Relates a CIF (Crystallographic Information File) to a specific UnitCell class.
Label: has Unit Cell

Comment: Connects a UnitCell with a Vector that stores the lengths of its axes. These vector labels are a, b, and c, the Unit of measurement is typically angstrom.
Label: has Unit Cell Lengths

Comment: Connects a UnitCell with a Vector that represents the angles between crystal axes. The vector components typically have labels alpha, beta, and have Unit of measure (usually degree).
Label: has Unit Cell Angles

Comment: Connects a UnitCell with a Vector that stores the lengths of its axes in the reciprocal space. The Vector labels are typically a*, b*, c*, the Units of measure reciprocalAngstrom.
Label: has Reciprocal Unit Cell Lengths

Comment: Connects a UnitCell to a Vector representing the angles between the axes in its reciprocal space. The reciprocal space is a mathematical construct used in crystallography and solid-state physics. The Vector labels are typically alpha*, beta*, gamma*, the Units of measure is degrees.
Label: has Reciprocal Unit Cell Angles

Comment: Connects a UnitCell to a set of vectors (UnitCellVectorSet) that define its axes in real space.
Label: has Unit Cell Vector Set

Comment: Links a UnitCell to a set of vectors (ReciprocalUnitCellVectorSet) that define the three vectors in reciprocal space.
Label: has Reciprocal Unit Cell Vector Set

Comment: Connect a UnitCellVectorSet or ReciprocalUnitCellVectorSet with individual Vectors that make up the set, in the real (Cartesian) space of the unit cell.
Label: has Vector

Comment: Links a UnitCell to its Value (of class Measure from the OM-2 ontology). Contains numerical value and unit of measure.
Label: has Unit Cell Volume

Comment: Connect the CrystalInformation class to its TileStrcuture.
Label: has Tiled Structure

Comment: Links the TiledStructure to the Tile entity.
Label: has Tile

Comment: Number of tiles in a crystal unit cell.
Label: has Tile Number

Comment: This class stores the numerical value for the number of tiles in the unit cell.
Label: is Number Of Tiles

Comment: Links the Tile to its Faces.
Label: has Tile Face

Comment: Links the tile and the number of faces in that tile.
Label: has Tile Face Number

Comment: The number of faces in the Tile Face.
Label: is Number Of Tile Faces

Comment: Link between the TiledStructure and the transitivity vector.
Label: has Transitivity

Comment: Information about all vertices of the given Tile Face. In cartesian coordinates.
Label: has Tile Vertex

Comment: Cartesian coordinates of the vertex in the tile face. Collection of all vertices can reproduce the entire tile face in 3D.
Label: has Position

Comment: The raltion property between a material and the XRDSpectrum of that material.
Label: has XRD Spectrum

Comment: Property to link the XRD spectrum and with each of its characteristic peaks
Label: has Characteristic Peak

Comment: Direction of reflection plane, that generated the characteristic peak. Optional parameter, may not be avaiable for experimentally measured spectrum.
Label: has Miller Indices

Comment: Property to link the XRD spectrum and its 2D plot.
Label: has Plot

Comment: Links the publication (Citation) and the author. This replaces the standard bibo:author_list
Label: has Author

Comment: The link between the publication and the Author.
Label: has Author Index

Comment: The link between the publication and the Author.
Label: is Author Index Of

Comment: A relation used in OM-2 ontology to store the human readable names of Units
Label: RDFS label

Comment: The value of uncertainty of a Measure. Both value and uncertainty use the same unit of measurement.
Label: has Uncertainty Value

Comment: This property specifies the index of the VectorComponent in the Vector. This property may be omitted if the hasLabel property is specified.
Label: has Vector Index

Comment: This data property of a MatrixComponent. It specifies in which column of a matrix this specific component (or element) is found. This property may be omitted if the hasLabel property is specified.
Label: has Column Index

Comment: This data property specifies of a MatrixComponent. It specifies in which row of the Matrix the Component is located. This property may be omitted if the hasLabel property is specified.
Label: has Row Index

Comment: A unique VectorComponent string idendifier (e.g. "x" in vector component "r_x"). Optional parameter: it can be omitter if hasComponentIndex is specified. Similarly, it can be an identifyer for MatrixComponent.
Label: has Component Label

Comment: Connects a VectorComponent or MatrixComponent to its value, which is a literal (a specific value like a number or a string). This property provides the actual numerical (or string) value of a Component of a Vector or a Matrix.
Label: has Component Value

Comment: Connects a VectorComponent or MatrixComponent to its value, which is a literal (a specific value like a number or a string). This property provides the actual numerical (or string) value of a Component of a Vector or a Matrix.
Label: has Component Value

Comment: Links the AtomSite in a crystal to its unique identifier, as it is defined in CIF file. A unit cell may contain several atoms corresponding to the same atom site label due to symmetry of the unit cell.
Label: has Atom Site Label

Comment: Occupancy of AtomSite in a crystal unit cell.
Label: has Atom Site Label

Comment: The Vector label in a VectorSet. In crystallography the label values for the unit cell vectors are one of "a", "b", "c".
Label: has Vector Label

Comment: The lattice symmetry family of the crystal.
Label: has Lattice System

Comment: The space group code accroding to the International Tables for Crystallography Vol. A (2002). An integer value from 1 to 230.
Label: has Symmetry Number

Comment: The symmetry symbol in Hermann-Mauguin notation.
Label: has Space GroupHM

Comment: The symmetry space group symbol.
Label: has Space Group Symbol

Comment: Total number of edges in given tile, or in given tile face.
Label: has Number Of Edges

Comment: Total number of faces in given tile.
Label: has Number Of Faces

Comment: Total number of vertices in given tile.
Label: has Number Of Vectices

Comment: The signature of a single tile. Different tiles may have the same TileCode.
Label: has Tile Code

Comment: Natural tiling signature. A string of the format 'k1[l1^m1.n1^p1...]+k2[l2^m2...]+...' Each bracket [...] represents a tile, k is the multiplicity of the tile. Values m and p are the numbers of polygons with l and n edges, respectively.
Label: has Tile Signature

Comment: An integer value, the number of Tiles or TileFaces, respectively.
Label: has Value

Comment: The face code of the tile face.
Label: has Face Code

Comment: A floating point number between 0 and 100, the height of the peak in range 0 to 100. It is measured in percent of the highest peak in the spectrum.
Label: has Relative Intensity

Comment: A floaring point number, the parameter of the
Label: has Peak Width

Comment: Position of peak, in crystallography the x axis is measured in 2*theta.
Label: has Two Theta Position

Comment: An flag whether the peak position was computed from atomic structure (True), or from fitting experimental data.
Label: is Simulated
